intro: Schizotheca hastata, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are usually less than 5 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters, which bloom during the spring and early summer. Schizotheca hastata is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley.
